result.execSummary:
The defendant Logan Michael Melton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for probation by 11:30 AM on 8/25/22.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $243 Court Costs. Payable through probation on Count 1 in St. Croix County case 22CM8.
- $200 DNA Surcharge. Payable through probation on Count 1 in St. Croix County case 22CM8.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- No contact with any Fleet Farm.

- Provide DNA sample.
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested.
- Obtain valid driver's license.
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's.
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent.
- Pay supervision fees.

10:40 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad with Kaitlyn Dippolito in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Logan Michael Melton. Defendant Logan Michael Melton in court. Court reviews case. Atty Dippolito recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count 1: Retail Theft- 943.50(1m)(b). Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:
I/S 5 Months Jail
 1 Year Probation 

-  3 months condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $243.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $ 200.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Sample
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- No Contact with any Fleet Farm 
- Obtain valid drivers license
- Obtained GED/ HSED
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation by 08/25/22 by 11:30 AM

to DE from clerk. Sign and return bond. Return by 03/25/22. Mailed to Washburn Co Jail. arc    Bond returned 03/14/22. arc
Status conference on March 24, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, All Fleetfarms.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
